All Reviews

  1. Easy to use and very flexible settings
  2. see ya later barber shop... no more 15.00 buzz cuts... this one does a great job!
  3. Pure crap, worked for a week, now it cant hold a charge for longer than 2 minutes.
  4. I hope remington continues to make this product as it works perfectly and saves me a lot of time. I got about 7 full haircuts and several quick trims before recharge. Charging is no big deal. You can't beat this product for the functionality and convenience.
  5. Despite reading many negative reviews, I bought one and have had no problem. Works just like it claims. I suspect that the people who wrote the bad reviews either didn't read the instructions or didn't understand them.
  6. This is by far the best head shaver I've come across. I've shaved my head with clippers for the better part of 15 years and this all I need. The rounded blades work well with the contour of your head. I remove the guard to get the closest possible cut. The width of these clippers make it less likely that you miss a spot. Makes for a painless, easy and quick job. As long as you clean and oil it along with periodic charges it will last a long time. I would advise against leaving it on the charger continuously in between cuts, I feel like it shortens the battery life. Great shaver and it also helps with shaping my beard. Must buy.
  7. I have had this product for 3 months and in that time have given myself 5 haircuts. It works as described. It is quick and efficient, just remember to clean the comb often, like after every back and forth. It makes a big difference. I keep my hair at about a quarter of an inch, the #2 setting on the unit. I do find it takes multiple passes both side to side and front to back to get all the stray hairs. In my case maybe 10 minutes from start to finish. Keeping that 10 minutes in mind I have gotten 3 full haircuts out of one charge. After the third it was still running strong but I didn't want to chance it running out of juice halfway through a fourth haircut. This unit combined with my Andis T-Outliner for the cleanup is simple to use (Have to recruit the wife to do around the ears) and it has paid for itself already compared to the barbershop.
  8. I dropped it a couple of times in the shower and a piece came off. I couldn't put it back together! The clipper worked fairly well to keep my hair short every 2 weeks. I liked how it was one length.
  9. This clipper works great and is easy and simple to use. The only drawback is that the battery cannot be replaced.
  10. Tired of barbershops? I was when I bought this three years ago. I have now saved about three hundred bucks, and am just now having some battery issues because I left it discharged for a while. Don't do that. This is the best of the personal hair trimmers I have used. It is so simple to just comb your hair and with the settings you can get it as short as you like. You will come to depend on this as I have, so take care of it. Remington really got this item right. Great gift item as well.
  11. The hair trimmer works just fine. Its the charging unit that isn't worth a plug nickel. After about three charges it stopped charging. I checked the charging unit and found that there was no output. I bought another similar unit from Radio Shack and was able to again charge the unit. I am aware that I could have returned it to Remington under the warranty but those things are more of a hassle than they are worth. Perhaps Remington should find another vendor for their chargers.<br /><br />As far as the unit is concerned, it performs exactly as I hoped it would. I trim my hair every three to four days and it never looks as though it has grown.
  12. Edit 11-18-2009: I've used this thing three times now and it's worked very well each time. That's $60 in savings on hair cuts so far, so it's more than paid for itself.<br /><br />This thing really gets the job done once you get used to it.<br /><br />If you currently have medium to long hair or if your hair is dense I highly recommend getting a haircut at a barber before you start using this thing. Otherwise, you're probably going to run out of battery power before you're finished. The battery on my Short Cut ran out just as I was finishing up the back. I had charged it all night and all day (sixteen hours as recommended in the manual). Yes, that's right, when you buy this thing you have to charge it for a full sixteen hours before the first use to get maximum battery life.<br /><br />I had medium to long hair when I started and the trimmer kept getting bogged down when I tried to comb it through my hair, so I had to make lots and lots and lots of passes to get it trimmed down to where the trimmer was fully functional even on the 4 setting (the longest setting).<br /><br />What I love most about this thing is when I go to the barber they never cut my hair the way I want it cut -- they can only give me a \\"number two\\" or a \\"number one\\" etc. unless I go to an expensive stylist. I'll tell them \\"I want a crew cut\\" and they'll trim off half an inch and go \\"is that short enough\\" and I'll say \\"no, shorter. Crew cut. Do you understand what that means? I want it short, like an army haircut\\" and they'll start over and do the whole thing again, taking off another quarter inch until I get tired of asking and just go home with my hair longer than I want...<br /><br />All I want is a short, \\"crew cut,\\" and this thing gives me exactly the cut I want. It cuts all of my hair uniformly to the same length, all around. For the cost I'm probably going to save a lot of money and annoyance.<br /><br />As mentioned in the other reviews, you'll want to get a trimmer for the sides and around the ears. They can be had pretty cheap. I didn't try the one on the Short Cut but because of the shape of the Short Cut I decided it'd be too awkward and I might botch the job. Speaking of botched jobs, you'll want to have a few bucks on hand the first time you use this thing so you can go to the barber and have them fix it if you mess up too badly.<br /><br />Note that even though you can cut your own hair with this thing you'll probably want to get someone else to trim up the back and behind your ears. The first time I used it, I forgot I had taken off the adjustable comb and went to finish up the back, and cut a huge nick out of my hair down to the skin. Fortunately it was far enough down that my roommate was able to use my trimmer to shore it up.<br /><br />Finally, hair will go everywhere. EVERYWHERE. Fortunately hair is easy to vacuum up.<br /><br />Overall, I'm happy with my sigourney-weavermatic.s and around the ears. They can be had pretty cheap. I didn't try the one on the Short Cut but because of the shape of the Short Cut I decided it'd be too awkward and I might botch the job. Speaking of botched jobs, you'll want to have a few bucks on hand the first time you use this thing so you can go to the barber and have them fix it if you mess up too badly.<br /><br />Note that even though you can cut your own hair with this thing you'll probably want to get someone else to trim up the back and behind your ears. The first time I used it, I forgot I had taken off the adjustable comb and went to finish up the back, and cut a huge nick out of my hair down to the skin. Fortunately it was far enough down that my roommate was able to use my trimmer to shore it up.<br /><br />Finally, hair will go everywhere. EVERYWHERE. Fortunately hair is easy to vacuum up.<br /><br />Overall, I'm happy with my sigourney-weavermatic.
  13. The first clipper I got did not work. I sent it back and the 2nd one works. The battery doesn't seem to last long so I worry it will not be good enough in a few months but it's fine for now. My head has some bumps ;) and uneven areas and at the lowest setting gave an uneven look. Looks OK at the higher settings.
  14. For those, like me, who shave their head to the same short length, these clippers are very well designed. The light feel and curved bi-directional blades make it a snap to cut my hair each week. BUT...the battery is absolutely horrible. It takes forever to charge and barely lasts one cut. You can't use the clippers with the cord attached so you are stuck having to charge overnight each time you plan to cut your hair. Too bad about the battery because everything else seems to be designed to be used each week to keep your hair trimmed neatly. But with the effort required to navigate around the battery's shortcomings, it is nearly impossible to use it weekly.
  15. BUYER BEWARE! - You will see many reviewers on here giving reviews a few months after owning the product and most of them have pointed out that the unit dies. It worked great for the first 2 months. I loved it - it was cheap, and worked as advertised! But after 4 months the unit would start shutting off about 45 seconds into cutting (after a FULL charge). I found out I wasn't the only one. Why don't they just let you plug it in and use it? The \\"cordless\\" battery feature is not necessary (who cuts their hair where there is no power source?) and that feature is the reason it died. The battery on this thing is useless and makes the product worthless.
  16. Simply the best for us balding short-hair do-it-yourself guys.
  17. I'M DISAPPOINTED WITH THE PURCHASE. BATTERY LIFE IS NOT WHAT I AM USED TO IN TRIMMERS. THE UNIT DIED THE 2ND TIME I USED IT. I'M AFRAID TO TRY IT ON MY HAIR AS THAT WAS THE MAIN PURPOSE FOR PURCHASING IT. THE BATTERY WILL PROBABLY DIE HALF WAY THRU. I'M GOING BACK TO WAHL.
  18. The Remington Short Cut Clipper is excellent for its stated purpose. As one who has recently decided to keep my hair trimmed very short, what some call a \\"buzz-cut\\" I have found it frustrating and tedious to maintain the cut with conventional hair clippers. I would miss places and would have to negotiate with the electrical cord in order to cut in all directions, since my hair wants to be curly when longer. With the Remington Short Cut Clipper I have attained an easy, brief daily maintenance device. It sits where my hair brush once resided, plugged in, fully charged and ready when I am at the basin doing my daily grooming, etc. I unplug it, check that the length setting is still where I left it last and then brush it back and forth over my scalp just as I would if I were brushing my hair. In about a minute and a half I am finished and I see an even cut all around. I thoughtfully read product reviews as I decide whether to buy something I've not physically touched and examined. In this case I found some of the reviews to be confusing because of their negative ratings and the reasons for them. The Remington Short Cut Clipper is a device that is meant to be used for maintaining a very short \\"buzz-cut\\" and it does that very well.
  19. This product already has a ton of reviews, so I doubt mine will make a big difference. The product works, as advertised. You can cut your own hair, without a mirror, easily and the results are great. It may suck for long hair, but I don't really care. My hair is SHORT and the more patchy and grey it becomes, the shorter it becomes. Make sure you fully charge it and it will not run with the charger plugged in (odd?). I use it like a toothbrush, cutting my hair every day. It is that easy. Downside: no case, so I bought a small travel cube for storage.
  20. The cutters only take a little with each pass, so u have to go over and over and over to be sure you got a full and even cut so it takes a long time to do even a basic trim.   21. I keep my hair cut short and was looking for a product that I could use between going to the barber every two weeks. On the ship, I was cutting my hair twice a day, that is how much I enjoyed the clippers. When I got off the ship, I spent a week in Florida and introduced my brother to the clippers, in fact I had to leave them in Florida for him and purchase a new set when I arrived back in New York. It is so easy to use, it os like brushing your hair. It is now November, my barber is wondering what happened to me, I have not been back to see him.These are the clippers I wished I had years ago, they are Great.
  22.   27. This is my second unit: the first one died after the warranty expired. That unit had a problem with the battery and charging unit. Hopefully, this one will last a bit longer. All in all, a good value.
  28. Not to belabor the issue as many others have already chimed in on this, but I can also confirm that the battery would no longer charges after ~6 months of usage.<br /><br />I've owned a Braun electric toothbrush set with rechargeable batteries that is still going strong after over seven years of daily use, and I own many other consumer-grade products with rechargeable batteries and this product is easily the worst at holding a charge.<br /><br />And just to be crystal clear here, if you can't charge this, you cannot use it, unless you think it would make a handsome paperweight. (It won't.)<br /><br />Clever idea but horrible execution. Fun while it lasted -- sort of.<br /><br />Caveat emptor!

  31. My husband is a 61-year-old balding man who decided to \\"go with the flow\\" and cut his hair very short since it obviously wasn't going to get any thicker! He has very fine, thin hair and these clippers just couldn't get all the hair no matter how many directions or times he went over his head. It was very easy to use and he liked the idea of being able to cut his own hair, but these clippers just couldn't get the job done. Remington offers a 30-day money back guarantee so we sent them back.
  32.   34. Love the design, but the item was underpowered from the first use. The [[ASIN:B0015K9BXQ Remington Short Cut Clipper Rechargeable, Cordless, Haircut Kit]] is underpowered and hence useless. Should have listened to The other reviews.
  35. While the concept sounds great - a supposedly simple way to give yourself a buzz cut, it's not what it promises. While it does work fine (not great) for the sides, back, and top, it's impossible to get a good cut around the ears (and before someone says something, I a nice pair of cute itty-bitty ears!). No matter how you hold it, you cannot get the front if the ear without risking an eyebrow - and even then, it misses the hair in front of the ear, and only trims the eyebrow! It claims to be a 1/8, 3/16, 1/4 inch groomer, it's, in actuality, a 0 (at most 1/32 - pretty much to the skin) (pos #1), a 1/16th (pos #1 1/5 - barely any more length that pos #1), and a 1/4 (pos 2). What happened to 1/8 and 1/16!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Finally, the balding guard (plastic shield used to adjust length of cut) traps the cut hair in it quickly, so you spend half the time trying to clean it (without cut hair flying all over the place), 1/4 cutting, and the other 1/3 trying (and failing) to finish cutting the hair - you guessed it - in front of the ears! Definitely the worst $40 spend on a shaver it \\"ears\\"! Better off spending the $15 on the standard clipper set you'll need to finish what this device started.
  36. This product is exactly what I was looking for. I buzz my head down to the scalp and the lowest setting does this without having to really dig in with the actual blades. I still own, and like, the Oster clippers that served me well for over 5 years, but the shape of this product, plus that fact that it's cordless, just makes is very easy to keep my head cut close. If you want to go completely bald, you should use shaving cream and a razor, but if you want to keep it tight, I would highly recommend this product.
  37. This clipper is a great find! I used to cut my hair using traditional clippers and would have to go over a couple times due to missing some spots. This one, I only had to do one pass-over to get the job done!<br /><br />I don't like the balding brush; however. It did not give me the closeness I wanted. I actually took the attachment off and shaved using the blades directly against my scalp. Worked like a charm!<br /><br />I have no review for the adjustable attachment though, as I only shave my head as close as I can get it.<br /><br />The trimmer portion needs a locking mechanism on it. Works great for the sideburns and around the ears, but on the neckline, not so much. The slightest bit of pressure pushes the trimmer in a little bit and causes the blades to stop moving. Therefore you have to hold the trimmer part out while trimming your neck....it's not that easy. All and all, it is a great set!<br /><br />For those that showed cons about the charging time; if you're like me it shouldn't be too much of a problem. I use it every 2 days, so it's plenty of time to get the charge in otherwise. The length of charging time is no problem for me.<br /><br />The price is not much more than a pair of traditional clippers as well, so it's definitely worth buying!<br /><br />I would definitely recommend this product to a friend!
  38. This clipper actually works very well.....however, the battery didn't make it 1 year using it bi-weekly. The sad thing is it doesn't work plugged in either. Once the battery goes you are finished. So imagine you are half way through a trim and the battery goes dead. You have a big problem! I know! It happened to me! It was still under warrentee so I sent it for service 1 month ago....no word back yet!
  39. A great hair clipper and easy to use when you do it yourself. The cordless rechargeable feature is great and the battery charge lasts for several haircuts. Shipment was fast.
  40. I'm balding and have had 2 of these clippers over a span of 3 years. My first clippers lasted me two years and I'd be surprised if my 2nd pair didn't last just as long. Great price for a great product. If you have a handheld mirror so you can see the back of your head- it is impossible to give an uneven haircut.
  41. I decided to pull the trigger on this trimmer and so far, very, very pleased. I'm one of those male-pattern baldness guys who only has hair on the sides/back...not the top, and this trimmer has really worked well. My head appears to have the right (rounded) contour for this device, which has a contour itself. You guys will need to exercise your own judgment on whether or not you have a \\"conforming head\\" :-). Here are a few tid bits that you may find useful: - if you wear glasses like I do, it's still hard to trim around the ears without your \\"eyes\\" on. What I do is to set the trimmer to one number lower (i.e., 2), fold my ear down, then and trim the sides... and back. As a DIYer, trimming the back is still difficult, so get a (or borrow your wife's) large hand-held mirror, or enlist her help. I know it sounds weird, but it's easier to hear the trimmer cut the hair (i.e., determine whether or not you're done, or there's more work to do) if you close-off one or both ears (e.g., just place your finger on the ear opening). You can actually hear (better) the blades trimming the hair, which provides some idea whether or not you're making progress. Although the manufacturer states that you can leave it plugged-in all the time, I don't. I typically use my own judgement to determine when it's time for a \\"power-up\\". The little trimmer on the device doesn't seem to be real effective, but it's ok, as I typically use another device for eye brows and side burns. Again, despite some rather damning reviews about it and the battery, I purchased it and glad I did--it's already paid for itself, and then some.
  42. Has paid for itself already. Easy to use and the results are consistent. It comes with two comb attachments and mine had the one with the shortest range (all the way to bald). If you want to have enough hair to brush it into shape, replace the comb with the other one before trying to trim your hair. At the highest setting, I get just the look I like.
  43. If you do some research you will see that there are many unhappy folks with this clipper, solely because of battery and/or charger problems. I emailed Remington customer service and they wrote back that the battery problems have been addressed. So I bought one.<br /> If you want a neat short haircut, this device is excellent. It will not easily cut long hair off, and easily loads up with softer hair even an inch long, but for a weekly short hair cut, it's perfect. The battery arrived with some charge, and filled quickly, as it has after each use. If the battery does fail, I will amend this review.<br /> I'm an older guy who has shaved his head for years. (What remains of my hair is UGLY!) This is WAY easier. My routine: I first set the trimmer to as long as the adjustment will go and run it carefully back and forth over my eyebrows getting rid of that shaggy old guy eyebrow junk. This takes 30 seconds and makes little or no mess in the sink. Then I step into the shower stall and run the clipper back and forth set on the shortest setting of the adjustable comb. It takes some repeated strokes, both front to back and from side to side, but no mirror is needed. It is easy to tell by feel if you have missed anything. Then I set the clipper out of the shower, turn on the water, and shower. The short trimmings are no problem for the drain. This is simple and neat, no mess. Sorry if I told you more than you wanted to know!!!<br /> July 10, 2012: The clipper continues to work perfectly. I charge it after each use and it stays fully charged until I use it again a week later. I am REALLY pleased with this product!<br /> ONE YEAR later. Still going strong, just as when it was new.
  44. I raced to my bathroom mirror to shave my head with this thing. One might say that I shave my head bald but actually I like to leave stubble. (I normally use a #000 attachment, which is 1/32 inch.) I left the shorter comb on and set it to the lowest setting. Thinking that it wasn't going to be short enough with the comb,I actually ended up cutting my hair shorter than I wanted to! I absolutely love how this gadget feels on my scalp (it's like a massage)and I am shocked at how even my haircut turned out. Shavers like this are destined to break down after a few years. Therefore, I am ordering another one of these and leaving it in the closet until that day comes. (Or should I order a couple of them? I am thinking about it!) Wow... this thing is amazing! Buy it!

But, this has been nothing more than a pain in the butt ... really. You have to go over like 100 times for it to even give anything remote to an even cut. I say just go buy a regular clipper. I bought the Remington clipper with vacuum and have been happy so far. Its fast and sucks out 98% of the hair. All in all this is nothing more than a fancy idea with little practical use.

I'm giving it 2 stars only because it worked well for me while it was able to hold a charge. I would definitely not recommend this to a friend.
  47. The [[ASIN:B0015K9BXQ Remington Short Cut Cordless Haircut Kit]] is an excellent idea but the product just doesn't deliver. I was really hoping this was going to work for me. Unfortunately, my experience with this product was mostly negative, and even for a minor trim around the sides I found this product to be poorly designed and without sufficient power.<br /><br />I do think there are a select few who will be able to use this product. If you have very fine hair, and tend to keep it between 1/2 inch and 1 inch long all around, this clipper can be a good supplement to normal hair-cuts. I don't think it sufficient to replace normal hair cuts for even this small group of consumers.<br /><br />If you have thicker or coarser hair that is longer than even 1 inch, this clipper is simply not powerful enough for giving yourself a trim. Similarly, if you want to trim your hair down to the skin, even at the lowest setting this clipper cuts unevenly. The problem is the blade angle, which is perpendicular to the scalp unlike a traditional clipper. Combine that with the slower cutting action likely the result of this unit running off of a rechargeable battery. The result is that it rarely cuts evenly and requires multiple passes.<br /><br />The size is adjustable by a dial on the inside of the handle that slides the guard farther or closer to the blade as you desire. There are two guards included, one with plastic tabs that prevent you from dialing this down to the lowest length setting. That one seems safer, but both guards seem impractical. Neither of them gives you the option of having longer hair than most Wahl home kits. I would estimate the longest length with this guard to be the equivalent of the 5 guard included with most home kits.<br /><br />Hair also collects within the guard causing the clipper to get clogged re-cutting hair. Having to remove this hair required me to remove the guard, slowing me down. Even just trimming around the sides and back with this clipper was not practical because of the time needed to constantly clean hair out of guard.<br /><br />Although I did notice that the battery wore down quickly, I never used it long enough to completely wear it out. Most cordless rechargeable units have battery issues, so I would be willing to forgive that if not for the lack of power. Those who keep their hair short all the time and don't have thick hair like I do aer likely to be able to perform a quick trim on one charge. It does seem to take a long time to fully charge.<br /><br />The instructions were boiler-plate. I didn't see any instructions on how long the battery should be charged and how to extend battery life. I will have to review the included manual, which has only a few pages of instructions in English and then duplicates them in Spanish and French.<br /><br />If you do end up getting it anyway, a few uses will be required in order to get the hang of it. On a positive note, the shape of the unit seems very well designed for comfortable operation. I will only add that you should make sure the blade is well oiled before use and that the unit is fully charged, as mine arrived with the battery drained.<br /><br />CONCLUSION<br /><br />For those with fine hair that is short to begin with, this can be a useful tool if used once a week so that the hair never gets too long. For most people, the lack of power combined with design issues makes this product impractical.<br /><br />Enjoy.because of the time needed to constantly clean hair out of guard. Although I did notice that the battery wore down quickly, I never used it long enough to completely wear it out. Most cordless rechargeable units have battery issues, so I would be willing to forgive that if not for the lack of power. Those who keep their hair short all the time and don't have thick hair like I do aer likely to be able to perform a quick trim on one charge. It does seem to take a long time to fully charge. The instructions were boiler-plate. I didn't see any instructions on how long the battery should be charged and how to extend battery life. I will have to review the included manual, which has only a few pages of instructions in English and then duplicates them in Spanish and French. If you do end up getting it anyway, a few uses will be required in order to get the hang of it. On a positive note, the shape of the unit seems very well designed for comfortable operation. I will only add that you should make sure the blade is well oiled before use and that the unit is fully charged, as mine arrived with the battery drained. CONCLUSION For those with fine hair that is short to begin with, this can be a useful tool if used once a week so that the hair never gets too long. For most people, the lack of power combined with design issues makes this product impractical. Enjoy.
  48. This is a great gadget to save cash, gasoline and time. It is however just for guys who like short hair. I find that the #2 setting is close but not too close for me. It leaves my hair about a quarter inch long. If you have a short flat top or just a short hair cut then it makes sense to migrate to this product. Don't misunderstand, you can't cut a flat top with it but if you are already wearing a close flat top (like I was) then you won't see much difference anyway. It does make a little mess with the falling hair clippings. My remedy for that is to just stand in my shower and use it once a week for about a minute and then turn on the water and take my usual shower. I'm happy to say I don't endure the beating of the barber shop anymore. [[ASIN:B0015K9BXQ Remington Short Cut Clipper Rechargeable, Cordless, Haircut Kit]]

  55. This rechargeable clipper by Remington is a great idea, and works well once you get the hang of it. The design is unique and has some excellent features. The cutting area and guards are curved to better fit the shape of your head. It is also a wider cutting area than traditional clippers so you can cut your hair much quicker. It is comfortable in your hand and comes with 2 guards that fit over the blades. Additionally, the blades can be raised higher or lower by turning a dial on the body of the clipper. So there is quite a bit of hair length adjustment possible. The cordless aspect of this clipper is especially nice.<br /><br />The instructions aren't especially helpful and I think their claim that it's fool-proof is a bit overstated. There is definitely a learning curve before you achieve excellent results every time. (I wouldn't use this for the first time the day before your wedding or something.) As suggested, you should start with a much longer setting that you actually want while you are learning. You can always make it shorter.<br /><br />The curved shape is actually pretty good, but there are places on most heads that are not curved, especially around and behind the ears. That's where it's tricky and takes practice, but an even cut can be achieved. The pop-up trimmer is very nice and works well.<br /><br />As mentioned by others, you can leave it plugged in between uses and you should. The charger does not work as an a/c adapter so you cannot use the clipper while it is plugged in.<br /><br />There have been several comments about these units breaking quickly. After a few months, mine began to have issues with not turning on. I think the switch design must be poor because after juggling and whacking my unit, I have always been able to get it to turn on (eventually). Of course, I am expecting that one day, it won't power on anymore.
  56. It just died on me after three years of minimal use. The charge now lasts about fifteen seconds. When it worked it worked ok. Am disappointed in its longevity.
  57. I have been using this to cut my hair since I bought it (I have short, balding hair that I wear in a brush cut). It worked great but just died after three and a half years--I think the battery is shot. Other than that, it was great.

Update 11-21-09 I was suprised to find that Remington was willing to warranty this product without a receipt. They asked me for the date code under the sliding sideburn trimmer. They sent out a replacement at no charge. However, the replacement worked for about 2 months and then it seemingly died as well. I was amazed that a forceful tap into my palm to jostle the internal parts actually brought it back to life. One of those one in a million things. It has worked since and I guess I will continue to use it until it dies again. This is obviously a trouble prone product. It also takes very very long to charge. Sometimes over 24 hrs. Good customer service from Remington but not a very good product. First I will say I have been trimming my own hair for the last 15 yrs. I have been very happy with this product until it recently went from working just fine to not taking a charge at all!! The battery just died with no warning. I have only had mine for about a year. This is completely unacceptable since my corded/battery operated Wahl trimmer which is over 10 yrs old will still take a charge with the original battery. Of course I can't find the receipt, so in the trash it goes. I DON'T TRUST THE FOUR YEAR WARRANTY STATEMENT! I dug outmy owners manual and it says two years. Maybe they have upped the warranty since a year ago, but I don't buy it! I used mine to bald my head, but after reading all the other reviews, it makes sense to me that anyone with the desire to maintain some hair length will not like this clipper. The problem is that there would be no way to accurately keep the clipper the same distance from your head even with the attachment on. This is a very long, curved blade and when you are trimming flat spots on your head you are much closer on the ends of the blade than you are on the middle. Try it at your own risk if you want bald. Stay away if you want to maintain some length. I will go back to using my old trusty!!

  62. I purchased this for $30 from a local retailer. It comes with a piece that allows you to cut 1, 1 1/2, 2, 3, and 4 cuts. Another piece will do \\"balding-cuts\\"; in other words, to cut your hair to the point where it is almost bald but you still have a little stubble left. I have cut my brother's toady and my hair two weeks ago with it so far. Here my impressions. First off, compared to your standard Wahl clippers, these make a mess. As others have indicated, the blades chop your hair into thousands of fine pieces. For clean-up's sake, this is a pain, especially if you are cutting someone's hair in your home. My brother's hair, when I cut it, is around a 2-inch length. I used a 1- 1/2 on his hair. I took two passes over his hair and the razor got clogged with hair, impeding the blades from doing their job. I had to take the plastic piece off, dump the hair that was impeding the blades, and put the plastic piece on again. I probably did this 12 times when cutting his hair. While this wasn't a huge pain, be aware of this fact: this razor is best-suited for cutting hair that is short and maintaining its short length.
  63. I have to say that I don't really like the bother of getting haircuts. I work very long hours as I'm the sole support for my family and I usually wait until I \\"have to go\\" and then I usually find one of those store front places like \\"Supercuts\\" or \\"Fantastic Sam's.\\" The cuts from those places vary from pretty good to not so good.<br /><br /> In addition, I have been going bald for the last 20 years and now I only have a little tuft of hair up front and I finally decided that I had had enough and I asked the stylist to \\"buzz all my hair off.\\" When she had finished I was surprised at how much I liked the look and how easy it seamed to cut it (it took her about 2 minutes).<br /><br />Later that week I went to Walmart and found the Remington and I have to say that it is a cleaver product that works well. It is small and lightweight and cordless. It basically looks like a brush. It is strictly designed for short hair cuts but it does those cuts well and you can adjust your hair length by turning a little thumb wheel on the clipper. In addition, it has a push out trimmer that also works well.<br /><br />You can actually cut your hair without a mirror and I tend to go into the tub to cut my hair and then take a shower to wash all the loose hairs down the drain when I'm done (the clipper in not waterproof).<br /><br />Because it is a small unit it doesn't have the power to cut through long hair. When my son wanted a haircut \\"like dads,\\" I first had to cut his hair down to size with traditional clippers and then I did the rest with the Remington. Several neighbors commented how nice his hair looked! In addition you have to occasionally \\"tap out\\" your hair from the cutting mechanism during a cut. Lastly, the power switch is easy to accidently turn off when you are holding the unit. All of these \\"complaints\\" are fairly trivial.<br /><br />All in all, if you have a short \\"buzz cut\\" this device delivers at a reasonable price. Definitely recommended.

  65. I have been thinking for quite some time to cut my hair real short, to counteract the ongoing thinness on my crown. Finally this Remington Short Clipper made me go for it. At first I was disappointed; inasmuch as my hair was shorter then I was hoping for. If you are looking to get 1/2\\" thick hair, you won't get it here. You're lucky to get 1/4\\". Going from long to short, you will need to go to about 1/8\\" first, and then let it grow in a little, and then go for the deepest setting.<br />It has been a couple of hours and I am starting to like myself with the thin top. With the fuzz on top that is left, I feel like I don't always have to wear a hat. This may sound odd, but I am seriously thinking of getting back into working out now. You know treadmill, and weight lifting. With the short hair I feel like I am in the service or something. It does give me a feeling of a desire to start to exercize again.<br />This razor is convenient because it is cordless. At first I was amazed at how flexible it is in terms of how deep of a cut you want to take. There are several settings you can easily change with the thumbwheel. It also comes with the balding safety comb; the one that extends beyond the teeth so your skin does not come into contact with the moving blades. You'll need to finish up around your ears with a pair of scissors if you are going for extra neat.<br />I did my entire head. If you keep going back and forth, causing the hair to stand up, it gets it all one length. This is not like the old barber shears that will bald you in a single pass. The hair gets caught in the safety comb, and with a light tap, or quickly pulling the long hairs out by hand it clears it for another pass.<br />I am sure this will be great for keeping a beard close for the winter. I used it on my moustache, and it doesn't do a very even job of it. I prefer scissors for my muzzy. :-)<br />Anyhow, I am glad that I have it. For the price it is a great unit. Just wish they had a medium length unit.

  68. You want a buzz or you want it bald? Those are your options with the Remington Short Cut Clipper. If that's what you want it works just fine, but be aware that this is for very short cuts.<br /><br />The whole thing fits nicely in the hand and can be used on oneself. Even on the bald setting there is a guard that keeps you from cutting yourself, which is a very nice feature. It comes with two combs, one for bald and one for buzzes of up to half an inch. The length setting is simple to adjust.<br /><br />After charging up it lasts quite a while. My only complaint is that there is no case to store the extra comb, or to carry the whole device and its charger plug.
  69. I keep my hair fairly short, so when I saw this product I figured it was worth a try. My first impressions were good, the packaging was easy to open, and the trimmer felt light and comfortable in my hand. The product comes with 2 combing guides, a cleaning brush, some oil for the blades, a charger, and an instruction manual (which was a bit confusing to read). I was disappointed that the product did not include a case to hold the trimmer and accessories, and that it took a long time to charge fully (16 hours).<br /><br />After charging it overnight, I attached the adjustable guide comb and set it to the highest setting, which gives a ½ inch cut (be warned that it comes with the balding guide already attached). I quickly went over my entire head, since the cutting blades work forward and backward. I then used the #3 setting to trim the sides, which gave me a tapered look, similar to the cut my barber gives me. I've used the trimmer twice so far and it's already paid for itself.<br /><br />One thing that is a bit of a nuisance is that the cut hair tends to clog the blades, making it necessary to clean out the loose hair periodically. The unit does come with a sideburn trimmer, but that feature is not very functional. It's difficult to get the right angle when using it, so instead I use my Wahl compact trimmer for the sideburns and around the ears.<br /><br />This product does a good job for its intended purpose. It gives a nice short buzz cut, quickly and easily. I subtracted one star because of the few shortcomings I mentioned above.

  74. I've been cutting my own hair for several years. I'd just had one bad haircut too many, and was tired of paying $12 for that misery. Using traditional clippers has always been tricky, switching out the various guards and trying to hold the thing just right. This brush-style clipper takes all the guess work out of cutting my hair myself. Especially the hard-to-reach back above the neck. I've used this unit twice now, and it blends perfectly into the longer hair on top my head. I have to admit, I have yet to cut the top with these clippers. Because I really don't want it THAT short. I can use my old traditional clippers on the top, and then trim the back and sides for a month with this Remington clipper. The job is so much quicker and smoother. Finally, I can look like I groom myself on a regular basis!
  75. This is a sorry product! That is all I can say. Can only cut hair 1 time on a charge. That is not saying much because I don't have very much so the clipper does not run but 2-3 minutes. Phillips-Norelco trimmers are FAR superior for not much more money and last for years. I thought I would try something a little different with the Remington but boy was I wrong. I definitely would not purchase this product ever again.
  76. I've been using this thing for 11 months. I have been cutting my hair very short with it as I am nearly bald on top.<br /><br />These are the reasons that I do not recommend it:<br /><br />1. While the curved surface might seem like a great idea, it makes for an uneven cut. Not sure how it works when cutting longer lengths, but when cutting it short I end up with a lot of places that are skinned and others that are darker because the hair is not cut as short there. It may be fine if your head is perfectly round. In the dark spots I really have to dig around to get it to not look so bad compared to the skinned spots.<br /><br />2. There really is no warning when the battery is going to run out of a charge. Be sure to have a backup or else you'll have a half-trimmed head. One second you're cutting hair and all seems fine, the next second it just quits. You think that maybe it is just clogged with hair, but no. The battery will need a very lengthy charge before you can resume.<br /><br />3. This unit cannot be used while plugged in.<br /><br />4. After 11 months of use, the battery on mine will not hold a charge for over a minute. Since I cannot use it plugged in, this thing is useless to me and will go in the trash.<br /><br />Nifty idea, but I will be replacing this with a new set of standard clippers.
  77. Unique product, works well. Two suggestions for improvement: 1. It's a hassle having to stop the clipper motor and use a small brush several times during the cut in order to remove accumulated hair. 2. Would like a drop charger.
  78. This product lasted only one year. It was eventually unchargeable, and would lose its charge after charging up, all by itself. It would die while in use, even when it was supposed to be charged. What a waste!
  79. I am usually looking for ways to shorten my time needed for a even cut. I ordered this knowing it will not replace my regular clippers. My hair cut is not an all around buzz which this product is designed for so take it with a grain of salt. I usually fade the sides and leave the top longer. But I usually see stray strands afterward so this was what drove my purchase of this unit. I gave it 3 stars for following reason and other reviews have mentioned these: - I can't replace the battery when its capacity will go down (all batteries will eventually lose its capacity through dis/recharging cycles so keep this in mind) - 14 to 16 hour initial charge time is long, but the slow charging of the unit probably to prevent the unit from overheating and prolong the battery's life - the unit will not run with the AC adapter plugged into the unit (so if the power dies on you in the middle of a cut, make sure you have a regular plug in clipper on hand) - the edge trimmer doesn't work, I tend to use my regular clippers to do the edges - you'll still need regular clippers if your hair is longer than 1\\" since the motor is probably not strong enough and angle of the blade isn't meant deal with the length/amount of hair So in my opinion bottom line: use regular clippers for the bulk of the cut, then use the Short Cut to finish.
  80. I now have two broken units and am very unhappy with this clipper's quality. Both stopped working after only a few weeks of use. The first just stopped and the second turns on but stops after a few seconds. Don't buy this clipper.
  81. I bought this product about 9 mo. ago. I got it from another retail outlet because it was out of stock through Amazon. After about 8 mo. of use the indicator lights for \\"on\\" and \\"charge\\" stopped working. I had never immersed the cutter or dropped it. As per the warranty instructions I sent it to Spectrum Brands in WI, the company that provides warranty service for Remington. The warranty information I received with this clipper said that the product would be repaired or replaced. After about four weeks I received a check from Spectrum for the purchase price of the product. The sales tax and shipping and handling charge that I paid were not included. This clipper did an adequate cutting job before it started to malfunction.
  82. It should be noted that I bought this with the intention of using it without any guide comb on for the shortest cut possible (I still reattach a guide to the unit just to protect the blades).<br /><br />It feels VERY natural to hold and because it's cordless there's no weight at the end to drag it down.<br /><br />Obviously the greatest factor is how wide it is and how quickly you can go. You'll never go back to traditional clippers again after this.
  83. The rechargeable battery doesn't provide enough time to cut your hair in one sitting. Despite the manufacturer's claim that a full charge will provide 40 minutes of cutting, I get no more than 10 minutes per charge. I can't comment on how well it cuts, since I've never been able to finish a haircut. Once the battery dies, you cannot continue using the clipper via the cord, and must wait 14-16 hours for the battery to recharge. If you can finish a haircut in less than 10 minutes, or don't mind cutting the top of your head on day 1, the sides on day 2, and the back on day 3, then you may find this clipper useful. Otherwise, look elsewhere.
  84. Advertised battery life: 40 minutes 1st unit: 4 minutes 2nd unit: 2 minutes Obviously Remington is suffering from some VERY poor quality control, yet they continue to sell these junkers. The product, and what it brings to the user, is simply a dream come true. Sadly, the non-replaceable batteries render these units non-functional should you be unlucky enough to get a clunker. With the first unit, it took me 3 full charges to get through a single trim. That's 48 hours of wearing a hat, because the charge time is set between 12-18 hours. Needless to say, I returned the first unit, and a replacement was sent to me through Kohl's. I acquired another Shortcut, and it was even worse!! Do NOT take a chance on this unit! It seems like people are having a 50/50 liklihood of getting a good unit, and those aren't good odds. 2/2 junkers for me, and that's enough to guarantee I NEVER purchase another Remington product. It's simply disgusting that Remington can turn such an amazing all-in-one device into a consumer headache just because they went with a bad battery supplier. They chose not to make the battery replaceable (AA would have been nice)--so the responsibility falls on them to ensure that the unit is properly powered for years to come. Shame on you Remington--you have lost a customer for years to come.
  85. Completely meets my expectations so much so that I ordered a second hair cliipper.
  86. i HIGHLY RECOMEND THIS HAIR CLIPPER. IT IS EASY TO USE AND DOES A GREAT JOB.
  87. As for the product, I love it...but what good is it if I can't use it. The rechargeable batteries in them are just straight up JUNK!! Expect to get only a couple of months use out of it. I thought I got a bad one, so I made the mistake of buying another one. Now this one is the same way after a couple of months of use. First your LED charging light will quit working, then your battery life will start to decline. After a month or so, you can literally charge it overnight and still not get enough charge in it to finish a good cut. Happened exactly the same way with BOTH of the ones I bought. I would buy another one in a heartbeat if they fix the battery problem, until then I cannot recommend this product or give it over one star (would give it a zero if I could).
  88. I love this device. I havent been to the barber shop in weeks. I can cut my hair at my own leisure. It gives you the perfect cut. I recommend for anyone with short hair, its perfect all you do is set the length and go.

However, until they fix the battery problem, it quickly becomes unusable and for that it deserves only one star.
  90. Re: my review below. Although customer service told me the product had been discontinued, and that I would receive cash back - in fact they sent me another clipper, which to date is working great. The power output to the motor is much better than my first clipper, and it cuts well. Based on current experience, I would recommend it. \\"I bought the clippers at the end of September, and when they work, they work fine. However, they never seemed to run at full speed. Note a number of other reviews that noted poor battery power. About 2 weeks ago they quit entirely - would not run, and would not charge. I e mailed Remington customer service and they responded quickly and told me to call their phone number 800 736 4648. The service agent asked for the model number, and said that the clippers had been discontinued by Remington 18 months ago. She said I could send the clippers to them, and I would be refunded the full purchase price. She commented, \\"If I send you another one, it won't work well either, all the batteries are old (because they stopped manufacturing so long ago).\\" Advice: Don't bother to buy one - it will quit. Too bad they stopped production, because as I said, when it ran, it worked great. I have purchased a set of Oster clippers since (also from Amazon) and they work great! \\"

  96. I purchased this product nearly a year ago and after having to exchange several times at Target store due to receiving defective units. It repeatedly stops even though fully charged and is flawed in several other ways. I have had 3 or 4 and have had the same problems with each unit, one that appears to be common with many other users. The unit has battery charging problems, \\"on\\" button problems, and cutting performance problems.   101. I bought these clippers seven months ago, and for quite a while I told all my friends how much I loved them. The curve worked wonderfully for my head, the guard gave an incredibly short cut, and I was a convert.<br /><br />The problem is, after about six months, the battery starts dying. You'll discover this the hard way when you're halfway through a haircut and it just turns itself off, over and over again. (And unfortunately, having half a haircut is a style that seems to be failing to catch on.) And as you start looking around online, you'll see (both here and elsewhere) that you're not alone in this problem; it's a defect in the entire line, not just your set of clippers.<br /><br />So understand that there are some rave reviews here; heck, I'd have written one myself in the first three months. But understand that sooner or later it will die on you, with very little warning. So here's what you need to ask yourself: is it worth buying a set of clippers that you know will cease functioning in about six months?<br /><br />I don't think so.

Additionally, the clipper height adjustment wheel is placed stupidly and can easily be moved accidentally during cutting - leaving you with some pretty hideous divots in a hair cut. Terrible product.
  111. This thing worked ok, not great, just ok. It doesn't cut longer hair very well. If I've got a couple of inches of hair and want to cut to the highest setting (#4) it has alot of trouble. The big drawback is the fact this this dumb thing refuses to charge after a very short time of owning it, within 3 months. I ordered a replacement and received one without hassle. Now a few months later and maybe 10 or 12 uses later the stupid thing won't take a charge again. I've tried it in multiple electrical outlets throughout my home. I can only come to the conclusion that this thing is made very cheaply and not built to last. The concept is nice but the implementation just doesn't live up.   117. I bought these after seeing an ad on TV and some reviews online. I am an American Soldier and hate spending 10-15 bucks a week for haircuts, when all that is being done is shaving it all off. So, I bought these clippers. Initially I liked them....you kinda had to go back over some areas, and they don't fit in and around the ears where your head isn't really round, but they worked. It took over 12 hours for the battery to charge, and by the time I was done shaving my head it needed to be charged again. Then after just a few months, while I was deployed, the things just quit working. They don't charge, and will only turn on for short periods of time. The real sucky part is that they cut out on me half way thru my haircut.....so half of my head was shaved and the other half wasn't. Imagine the looks I got as I walked over to the barber shop!!! Spend another $15....buy something that has a decent warranty and will actually cut your hair. (Yeah, Remington claims that my clippers were manufactured more than two years ago and are out of warranty!!) But stay away from this discontinued fad!!!
  118. The actual shaver works perfectly for me, I can get a quick trim before class or work in the mornings without too much fuss. The problem is in the electronic components; the battery is faulty and charge times gradually increase until the unit refuses to charge. This is a known issue that Remington has not corrected in the product. Also, the way the product is engineered does not allow you to directly plug the unit in the wall and use wall power to power the shaver like many Braun facial hair shavers do, so when the battery fails, the entire unit fails entirely. Mine failed after about a year of usage, I've heard others fail much earlier. Wait until Remington fixes this issue before purchasing one of these, or ignore the product completely. It will just break on you anyway.

  123. I was skeptical when I bought the Short Cut, apprehensive as hell the first time I took it to my head. No more. This thing is amazing! I used setting 3 on already short hair from a barbershop visit (my last, I think) 2 1/2 weeks ago. In 2-3 minutes, my hair looked exactly as it did when I last left the barber's chair: Really short, cleanly cut, even all over. Simple. Flawless. Even (dare I say?) FUN. I ran it slowly and steadily back and forth from front of head and down the back, then back the other direction, then ear to ear over the top, then back the other way, then along each side above the ears. You can use this baby about every 7-10 days (takes all of 2-3 minutes) and keep your hair exactly the length you want in perpetuity with nary the need for another time-consuming barbershop visit. Absolutely amazing. Now I'm thinking about going to a 2 and see what happens. I used setting 1 to trim the lower regions of my neck in the back and this seems to have worked well. It seems that many of the gripes in this review section are from people who tried with little success to cut through long hair with it. The SC just is not designed for this. What it IS designed to do is keep already short hair short, or shorter. What I did, and would suggest, is to visit the barber one more time and get your hair cut as short as you want, then when it just starts to get too long, go over it with the SC. But, jeez, I just don't see how anyone can screw it up. Update, 8/1: I found that the best way to get a quick, even cut is to wash your hair, let it dry completely (about 3 minutes with super short hair), THEN use the short cut. This way your hair is straight up all over and doesn't have a chance to get flattened anywhere on your head. Also, just spread a sheet of newspaper over the wash basin; this catches almost all the hair. Just fold it up and toss when you're done. I've also done my cutting over the wash basin itself which seems to catch just about all the clippings. Then you just take a folded piece of toilet tissue, wet it lightly and scour the inside of the bowl. You get about 90% on the first pass, then use a dry sheet to clean up the rest. I'm really surprised at the some of the problems reported in the negative reviews. The whole process is about as simple and efficient as is realistically and reasonably possible.
  124. I received the Remington Short Cut Clipper on 10/31. Gave myself a haircut the same day. Looks great. Works as advertised. I will buy a second set. Even if I experience the charging problems other reviewers have noted, it's still a great value. Each time I use it I save $20 so the next time I will have recouped my investment.
  125. I bought this to replace the one I bought last year (at twice the price back then!). I wish the product was built to last longer, but it seems true that most units will die of a bad battery within a year. If it had the option to run with the power cord I would have been content with that just to get more use out of it but it will not function while plugged in. Having said that, if it did not allow me to cut my own hair and save $15-$20 each time I use it (once a week) I would be angry at the short life span. But it does such a great job and allows me the freedom and ability to cut my own hair without looking like a clown afterward that I can't be too angry. I feel I've gotten my money's worth out of it even in the short time it worked for me. I just wish companies took more pride in their products and built them to last. If another company had something like this I would definitely give them a try, hoping for better battery life. Other than that the unit is sturdy and easy to use and the results are reliable. Had the battery not been an issue I would gladly give this 5++ stars.

  131. I can't fault this clipper on very much. It works well and certainly works better than using a traditional set of clippers and spacers ... especially when using it by yourself. It does take a great long while to charge (average 12 hours) but once it's charged, it lasts quite awhile and according to the manual you can just leave it plugged in if you want. Since there's no outside suction involved, you have to move the unit around on your head pretty vigorously to get an even cut and hair clippings go everywhere, but I just stand in the shower enclosure and then shower afterwards and it really is no problem. The unit seems to be well made and hasn't missed a beat for the last month that I've been using it. So far it's the best solution I've found for cutting your own hair. Just remember that it's for folks that keep their hair 5/8\\" or shorter.
  132. I used this clipper last week. It really does ok but I think it needs to be often, like every week or maybe two. It took some time to cut the way my previous Remmington clipper did.
  133. Bottom line: I've used mine for 1.5 yrs to maintain my buzz cut with a trim every 2 weeks or so. Just now it seems my power brick died, and I don't mind buying another for $25 on Amazon. One downside that I find quite annoying is that it doesn't work at all while plugged in. Why the heck is that? So if you're in a pinch and the battery is dead, you can't plug it in and use it. You have to wait until it's charged. I was also hoping they'd have upgraded the model in the past 1.5 yrs, but apparently now.
  134. I was very happy when I first got this. It was easy to use & coming from self clipping with a traditional clipper this was a dream. The two things I noticed right away was that your hair would bunch up in the clipper guide & you have to clear it out every 1-2 strokes. This wasn't a problem to me as long as the thing worked.<br />Very soon after I became hooked on it the battery started to die quickly. So fast that with a full charge I was only able to do half my head. Try explaining that to people.<br />I returned that one & the second one was decent for a month then just stopped dead. Returned for a third & that one worked for about 7 weeks then something inside came loose & rattled. Again the battery would die quickly & the power of the clippers went down in strength, even when fully charged.<br /><br />If they would make these with any real materials instead of the cheapest plastics & motors (I opened mine to see what was going on.) The mount for the motors are junk & don't hold tight losing power. The plastic the clippers mount into are cheap, weak & made very thin so they break easy.<br /><br />I'm going back to the old barber shop style. Oster makes the very best if you're interested.
  135. The idea was great, but even with my husband's fine, thin hair it would miss lots of hairs, right in the areas that should have been no issue.<br /><br />However, the worst part is, that it is DEAD after only a handful of uses!! Apparently the switch just died.<br /><br />The only thing they would do is refund us if we mail it back to them but the shipping would negate the refund. More so I hate the environmental affect of tossing something after such a short time of use. Wish we could go back to the days when things actually WORKED and lasted for 30 years like our parents/grandparents had.
  136. This hair clipper cuts great! I will mention though that unless you want a buzz cut (practically bald), you'll need to ADJUST the height level on the DIAL on the bottom side of the clipper (side opposite of the power button). I made the mistake of just reading the reviews and went off the one person's advice to change the guide if you don't want a bald head, so right after I opened it, I immediately swapped the guides, charged it, then went straight to cutting my son's hair. BIG MISTAKE. After the damage was already done (front and center-LOL), I had to go ahead and even it all out. When I was almost finished I finally turned it over to blow some hair out of the guide and noticed the dial, which made the guide shift up and down. If I would've adjusted it to begin with, it would've been perfect, but that was my stupidity. The clippers cut great though. I will not be taking my son back to the barber now that I have this.

  141. 1. I does what is says it should do, cut short hair, and does it well. 2. It can \\"on the paper\\" be cleaned under water. 3. It works when charged (but that takes it's time). I bought this model in a Remington gift-pack (with a horrible and useless nose/ear clipper). The first thing I remember was that it seemed to be a low-cost model. It was difficult to connect the charger correctly (had to pull it out and in many times before it started to charge). BTW, it takes over a half a day to charge it. Fully charged it handles about one hair-cut, thats it. After some time, I guess the battery power will be so low that it need in to be connected when used. It does it's job well when you want short hair, period. It's long bent form make it easy to shave/cut your hear. The quality of the product is poor, sorry to say say so. It looks good when you open the box, but after a little time, you find it's faults. Examples: Poor connection between the charger connection, the plastic hair accessories breaks easily (the ones you use when you cut your hear, and remove when cleaning). My item also began to take in water after a while, even though it said that the shaving blades could be cleaned under water. This could been a great/fantastic product, but is clearly made as inexpensively as possibly.

  146. Mar 2010: I bought this over a month ago. Gave myself about 4 or 5 simple haircuts so far. Sure easier and cheaper to stay neat and trimmed than going to the barber. Before each haircut, I would plug the clipper in to be charged overnight. This last time (2 weeks from last haircut), it seemed to have fully charged in about an hour. I set it at size 1.5 and run it around my head. This is the easy part. Then, I would use my hand as a guide to get cleaned up at the lower back side of my head. As for around the ears, I take out the guide then carefully run is over my hair - taking out a bit at a time until I am happy that it does not touch my ears. That's it! BTW, I do not have battery problem like other posts. I am keeping my fingers crossed. Oh, one thing about using this clipper is that you have to shake loose the hair clipping from the inside. It's not hard. I did have a regular clipper that I used previously, but I would need someone to help me with cleaning up the back of my neck and the side. Maybe I am just not that good at it. Apr 2011: Around the latter part of 2010, I rinsed the clipper under running water. I probably overdid it since the battery no longer holds strong charge and the blue LED no longer lights up. A few times, it would seem the battery is running out which could have meant a half done haircut. I finally got fed up with the battery issue and bought another one today. It is charging as we speak. I shall take care of this second one better. Oh, as a \\"year after\\" review, since I cut my hair weekly with this clipper, I potentially saved $500 in haircuts this past year - not to mention savings in gas (driving) and time (waiting).
  147. Probably one of the best clippers I've used. Nice design and makes quick work of the cut...a little awkward around ears, and not so easy to clean...but I love it.
  148. As a balding guy, this seemed like a perfect tool. Zip, zip, done. The contoured head works great for the top of one's head. And if my head were perfectly round and without ears, I would have been happy with this. While it works great in the top of the head, it does not work well on the sides, and you can forget about trimming hair anywhere near your ears. I used it maybe 8 times then went back to a traditional hair clipper for two reasons: the ones listed above and because it broke. It stopped taking a charge, and it does not work while plugged in. I called Remington's 800 number and was told I could ship it back to be repaired. The cost to do that would have been more than I paid for it. Save your money.
  149. I bought these thinking I would be able to give myself a Marine Corps regulation haircut and save myself hundreds of dollars every year. I want to point out to others who may be interested in buying these for the same reason: You CANNOT give yourself a fade with these. They are developed to cut your hair the same length on your entire head. I gave them to my younger brother, who likes them because that's the way he cuts his hair. For me though, I picked up a cheap pair of Wahls at Walmart.
  150. This did not work like I was hoping it would. If your hair is already short, this will not work very well. At least for me it didn't. I was looking for an easy way to keep my head buzzed as short as possible without using a blade razor. I tried this product without any success. The different plastic attachments act like normal clippers, meaning they will come at the hair at 90 degrees, but the cutting blade is vertical. Try using regular clippers by holding them vertical to your scalp and see the mess it makes. Same concept as standing your lawn mower up on its end and trying to get the blade to cut the grass. Well, that is what happens here. I guess if you have long hair this design will work, but for short clean shaven hair, it does not work. I returned this product for a full refund.

However, if you plug in the charging cord the product will not function. Nevertheless, when the product does work it works well and I continue to use it, I just wish it would stay charged for more than one use and the blades would work at a speed that creates a more comfortable cutting experience.

Keep it oiled and it will give you great haircuts time and time again.

  166. I bought this product with the hope that it would cut my hair shorter than standard clippers, and with less hassle. It's been everything I hoped for. I find that it's relatively fast to get a nice, short haircut, and the fact that it's cordless is a big plus. The fact that it's curved allows a larger area of your head to be in contact with the clippers. That really speeds things up. I find that it takes a long time to recharge, several hours, but once you determine that, it isn't a problem. I set the clippers to cut the hair as short as possible, using the balding comb on setting \\"1\\", and go over it every day to keep it looking sharp. It can be used for over a week without needing to be recharged, even when used every day. I just get into the rhythm of charging it once a week and it's never a problem. The way it holds all the hair clippings makes it a lot cleaner than conventional clippers that make a big mess. I'm totally sold on this item, and I'm glad I stumbled upon it.

  169. Very bad please return my money
  170. The Good: The clippers make short work (no pun intended) of getting your hair cut. The curved clippers make it easy to get an even cut on most areas of your head, with the exception of around the ears and the sideburns. In those areas a set of flat clippers would be nicer. The Bad: The battery life is terrible. After 6 months I find myself charging it after each use which doesn't sound too bad except for the fact it only takes 5 minutes to shave your head. Also, the motor seems to speed up and slow down on its own, which I attribute to the battery. I could live with a bad battery if I could just plug it in and continue to use it while charging but the unit will not function when plugged in, which is just plain annoying. So all in all, after 6 months, I find myself in the need of a new pair of clippers, which is really not as bad as it sounds as the clippers are very inexpensive and after 2 haircuts/trims they've paid for themselves. It would be nice if the battery lasted a *little* longer though.
  171. This razor excels at cutting your hair off in uneven clumps while scraping your scalp to the bone! If you want a consistent length of hair, you're in luck, provided that length is \\"no hair at all.\\" If you use the guard, then your hair may not get cut at all, or it may just be cut unevenly. As for the shape of the device, I can just say that there's a reason razors usually have their clippers in a straight line -- because it works. This shape only ensures that the blades will be some unguessable distance away from your scalp at any given time, adding to the \\"I gave myself a haircut\\" feel that every man dreams of, and every woman wants. To top it off, you have to plan your hairscrape (not so much a hairCUT) a good 4 - 8 hours in advance, since it'll only hold its charge for about 2 or 3 days.
  172. Worked for a couple of years, but the battery ended up not holding a charge. Ended up just trashing it. When it worked, it cut the hair evenly and quickly. You definitely want to take a shower right after as it can leave hair &#34;dust&#34; all over.
  173. I've been using Amazon for a VERY long time, but I've never felt compelled to write a review for a product...until now. The concept of this cutter is pretty good, but the execution is absolutely terrible. Since I started balding I've kept my hair cropped pretty close. When I saw this product I thought, wow this a good way for me to keep my hair neat by myself and not spend about $20/mos. on hair cuts--that's $240/year for what is essentially just someone occasionally running a trimmer over my hair. The product does a pretty decent job, when it's working. It won't do the full job--you'll need a small trimmer to get around the ears and something more manageable to crop very close around the neck, but with a little patience and a little planning you can get a pretty good close crop. I normally start with a 3 setting with the normal comb over the entire head and work my way down to the balding comb tapering along the way. In concept it makes it easy for someone like me to trim their own hair. Unfortunately, the build quality is terrible. My second clipper just crapped out. The first one died after just two cuts (i.e., less than two months)--it wouldn't hold a charge and the charging light wouldn't light up. Remington replaced it (I sent it to Remington and never heard anything--after a couple of months I had to call them up and ask them about my clipper and they had no record of my sending it back) and this one lasted about 9 months--figure maybe12-15 cuts, certainly less than 20. Over time it had more and more difficulty holding a charge when finally it dies almost immediately. I suspect that this may be a case of battery polarity reversal after it's discharged completely. This is really frustrating, as I really could use a product like this but it is a major hassle and just very poorly executed. On the Remington site one reviewer claims that the newer SCC-100R that replaced the SCC-100 fixes the problems. Well...if lasting a mere 20 cuts over lasting 2 cuts is \\"fixed\\", then I guess it is. Most people would not consider this a \\"fixed\\" product. This product is a great concept. Why can't Remington make this product work!?!?!? I'd easily spend three or four times as much for a durable quality build product. Remington, don't try to save $1 on build quality. You're frustrating your customers, eating into your profit margins on returns and repairs, and causing significant brand damage. Please fire the people responsible for ruining this potentially great product. What sort of company puts this crap out and then keeps shipping it with such obvious problems? What it says to a consumer is that YOU CAN'T TRUST Remington. BTW, why does this product ONLY work off of the terrible rechargeable battery? If it, at least could operate while plugged in I could get more life out of it. Perhaps it has something to do with the product being \\"washable\\"--they don't want it plugged in while it's running under the faucet, I guess.

  180. I've had my unit about three years now and really like it (use it about twice per month). It's paid for itself over many times. I bought one for my Dad who had battery / charging issues soon after he received it. With any rechargeable battery(s), you should always keep the batteries in a fully-charged state for longer life. As soon as I am finished using it, I fully charge it. Then, when I'm about to use it, I plug it in to be charged (it usually is already fully charged). I found that if I leave the charger plugged into it, but not plugged into the wall socket, I lose some charge. With my \\"lumpy\\" scalp, the shortest settings will leave little \\"patches.\\" I'm thinking of buying a \\"back-up\\" unit as I know someday the batteries will age to the point I cannot complete a haircut.

  194. I am pleased with the results of using the Remington Short Cut Clipper. The most important thing you can do is read and understand the instructions before using. Start with the longer cut and work your way down to the shorter range until you find what works best for you, unless your going for the shaved head. I especially like the curved cutting head as it fits the conture of your head. This helps to eliminate the \\"stepped\\" look you may get with a straight cutting head. It works well in both directions (up & down).

  196. DO NOT BUY THIS. IT IS THE WORSE ITEM I HAVE EVER BOUGHT. IT FREAKING TAKES 16 HOURS TO CHARGE AND ONCE CHARGED ONLY CUTS FOR ABOUT 5 MINUTES.
